✨ About The Role ✨

  • You'll be the eleventh engineer in the ML team, working alongside great talent from various backgrounds.
  • You will have full ownership of your ML work streams when applicable, or work with teammates on big topics. You have expertise and ownership; you have a say in how that goes.
  • You will master the whole pipeline, from training models to putting them into production and monitoring their performance.
  • You will work on new features, new applications, and some 0→1 solutions.
  • You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly. You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.
  • You will work within a small multicultural team composed of ~75 passionate, friendly & committed folks.

✨ About You ✨

  • You have 3+ years of experience with PyTorch, Tensorflow or Jax, and are willing to start or keep working with PyTorch.
  • You have a deep experience with diffusion models, for image creation or edition**.** You’ve trained diffusion models from scratch, or practiced deep surgery beyond their original pre-training.
  • You are always the most pragmatic person in the room.
  • You favor speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel.
  • You have experience working on products requiring complex architectures.
  • You have a strong sense of ownership.
  • You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.
  • You have worked as part of a talented team and have experience in a fast-growing startup.
  • You’re curious, are comfortable with explaining or learning depending on the situation. The team has deep expertise and values knowledge sharing and humility.
  • You are fluent in English (French is not required!).

✨ Hiring Process ✨

  • Screening call with our Head of AI
  • Home technical assignment, reviewed with the team
  • Culture fit interview and meet the team!
  • Reference check & Offer

Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:

  • We have flexible working hours
  • We trust people to work remotely
  • We extended the length of the parental leave

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Title: Head of Translational Research - Data science / IA
Description:
1️⃣ What you'll be doing

📝 Your job

Job Summary:

Translational Research at Resilience plays a critical role in shaping the future of precision medicine. As Head of Translational Research, you’ll be at the forefront of transforming real-world data, digital biomarkers, and RPM technologies into actionable insights that advance clinical care in oncology, immunology, and psychiatry. Reporting directly to the CMO, you’ll define a high-impact strategy that strengthens our scientific credibility, accelerates innovation, and supports regulatory and clinical partnerships. This is a mission-critical role—your work will directly influence patient outcomes and the future of evidence-based healthcare.

Your daily responsibilities & routine:


Define and drive the translational research strategy in close collaboration with the Chief Medical Officer, ensuring alignment with the company’s broader scientific and clinical goals.
Lead scientific research and data analyses to support the credibility and clinical value of our Resilience RPM platform across patient care, regulatory interactions, and drug development.
Identify, validate, and integrate digital biomarkers and novel clinical endpoints into Resilience Care solutions, collaborating across product, data science, and medical teams.
Apply advanced AI/ML and statistical modeling techniques to large, complex datasets—ranging from clinical records to wearable and passive data—to generate predictive insights and enhance patient outcomes.
Design and execute emulated clinical trials and synthetic control arms to expand our real-world evidence capabilities and produce regulatory-grade insights.
Ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory guidelines and GCP standards, particularly in research execution and data management.
Communicate research strategies, progress, and findings both internally and externally, including presentations at scientific conferences and publications, in alignment with our scientific communication strategy.
Act as a cross-functional liaison, particularly with Medical Affairs and Regulatory teams, to ensure our translational research informs both product development and scientific dissemination.


✨ Your Team

You Will Work Closely With:


Medical Affairs, to generate and coordinate impactful scientific publications and congress presentations.
Clinical Development, to support regulatory interactions (e.g., EMA, FDA), particularly for submissions involving RWD.
Life Sciences Partnerships, to produce evidence aligned with the needs of industry collaborators (pharmaceutical, biotech, medtech).
Product and Data Science teams, to translate research outputs into scalable, compliant, and clinically meaningful product features.


2️⃣ What you'll bring

⚙️ You'll definitely have:


PhD, MD, or PharmD in clinical research, biostatistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, AI, or related disciplines strongly preferred; MSc with relevant experience also considered.
5+ experience in translational research, clinical analytics, or digital biomarker development within pharma, biotech, medtech, or academia (with strong industry partnerships).
Demonstrated success in biomarker discovery, validation, and integration into clinical workflows.


🙂 You are the right person if you:


Have deep scientific rigor with an applied innovation mindset
Have strong interpersonal and leadership skills, with a proven ability to work cross-functionally.
Have excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex scientific topics to diverse audiences.
Are fluent in both English and French


💛 Resilience is for you if you...


want to join an ambitious project!
want to have an impact!


3️⃣ Recruitment


Interview 1 with Charles Ferté, our CMO
Interview 2 with Lucas Camedescasse, our VP Lifes Sciences
Interview 3 with Ivan Panico, our Data Science & Machine Learning Lead
Interview 4 with Emilie Filoni - Culture Fit


GDPR : Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. They will be available only for people involved in the process and erased after 2 years of inactivity.

Under GDPR and as Resilience attach great importance to privacy, please note that you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased. The Data Protection Officer can be contacted at privacy@resilience.care

For more information, please check our privacy policy.

Title: Senior Scientist Oncology Data Science and AI
Description:
Are you ready to redefine cancer treatment and restore patients' lives? At AstraZeneca, a global science-driven biopharmaceutical company, we are committed to discovering and delivering innovative medicines that enrich lives. Our Early Data Science team within the Oncology Data Science and AI group is expanding to tackle the challenges of pre-clinical and clinical big data generation initiatives. We are seeking a talented bioinformatician with expertise in cancer genomics to join our team. You will work alongside drug project teams to deliver multi-omic profiling and support the characterization of preclinical models and patients from clinical trials. Additionally, you will develop cutting-edge transcriptomics and genomics methodologies to expand the biology we can capture from our data.

Accountabilities:



Leverage multi-omic data from preclinical models and patients to understand the mechanism of action of our compounds.
Collaborate with project teams to define novel markers of response and resistance from preclinical models and clinical trials.
Develop and apply computational approaches with a focus on drug portfolio applications.
Apply innovative computational/statistical algorithms and visualizations to generate actionable biological insights from genomic data.
Discover and develop new molecular target, mechanism, and biomarker hypotheses.
Link multi-omic data sets from patients and in vitro/vivo models.
Integrate and interpret proprietary and public data spanning multiple platforms.
Engage in knowledge sharing and peer support, including training bench scientists in critical Oncology bioinformatics tools.
Build and steer development of prototype tools for bench scientists to access and visualize project data.
Collaborate with industry and academia to find effective solutions to drug discovery problems.
Publish work in high-impact journals.



Essential Skills/Experience:



Relevant PhD (or equivalent) plus at least five years of relevant applied experience combining technical expertise in computational biology, bioinformatics, data science, or applied biostatistics.
Experience and knowledge with data from clinical trials; expertise in either cancer genomics, transcriptomics, spatial or single-cell technologies would be essential.
Proficiency analyzing and interpreting data from multiple 'omic platforms (NGS sequencing, transcriptomic, epigenetic, proteomic etc.).
Expertise in the analysis of genomic data (WES, targeted panels, WGS) covering QC, handling, processing & interpretation.
Expertise in querying, mining, and interpreting cancer variants and associations with clinical outcomes from real-world datasets (TCGA, MSK-IMPACT, Flatiron, Tempus).
A proven track record of clinical/translational/biomarker research (experience in pharmaceutical industry is strongly desired).
Highly developed communication skills in conveying concise biological insights from analysis of complex data.
The ability to successfully lead in a matrix setting, partner with diverse stakeholders, and deliver impacts on tight deadlines.



Desirable Skills/Experience:



Publication record in either cancer genomics, bulk or single-cell transcriptomic applied to cancer.
Experience with spatial transcriptomic data analysis from GeoMx or Xenium platforms.
Knowledge of databases of clinical interpretation of cancer variants.
Biological understanding of cancer signaling pathways.
Expertise in the development of novel statistical approaches for the analysis of biological data.
Awareness of machine learning, graph modeling, artificial intelligence, Bayesian analytics or other non-traditional approaches to model biological data.
A thorough understanding of the contribution of bioinformatics to drug discovery.
Well networked within external bioinformatics and oncology communities.
Capability of successfully managing multiple simultaneous projects.
Working effectively within cross-disciplinary science teams, including with functional leaders.
Experience contributing to the research community through publication, conferences, and code.



When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we're not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

AstraZeneca is where courage meets curiosity! We are dedicated to eliminating cancer as a cause of death by fusing cutting-edge science with the latest technology. Our collaborative research environment unites academia and industry to expedite breakthroughs in some of the hardest-to-treat cancers. With a commitment to improving millions of lives, we empower our teams to lead at every level, ask questions, and take smart risks.

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Lead Data Scientist (Python/PySpark)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Qué estamos buscando?

Actualmente, tenemos un puesto vacante para un/a Lead Data Scientist (Python & PySpark Expert) que quiera unirse a nuestra compañía. Buscamos una persona con una sólida trayectoria en ciencia de datos, capaz de liderar equipos, diseñar estrategias analíticas y guiar la implementación de soluciones avanzadas en entornos de Big Data.




Tus principales responsabilidades serán:

Definir la estrategia y visión de ciencia de datos, alineándola con los objetivos de negocio para maximizar el impacto del análisis de datos.
Supervisar el desarrollo e implementación de modelos de machine learning y técnicas de optimización avanzada, asegurando su escalabilidad y rendimiento.
Liderar equipos multidisciplinares de científicos de datos e ingenieros, proporcionando orientación técnica y estratégica.
Diseñar y mejorar arquitecturas de datos, asegurando el procesamiento eficiente y gobernanza de los datos en entornos distribuidos.
Implementar pipelines de datos avanzados y automatizados, con un fuerte énfasis en Python y PySpark, optimizando procesos de ETL en sistemas de Big Data.
Explorar y evaluar nuevas tecnologías y enfoques analíticos, proponiendo mejoras para mantenerse a la vanguardia en la innovación de ciencia de datos.
Colaborar estrechamente con stakeholders del negocio, traduciendo necesidades estratégicas en soluciones concretas basadas en datos.




Requisitos deseados:

Experiencia profesional de más de 8-10 años en Data Science, con enfoque en machine learning, optimización y análisis avanzado de datos.
Amplia experiencia con Python y PySpark, incluyendo el desarrollo de soluciones escalables en entornos de Big Data.
Sólido conocimiento en frameworks de machine learning.
Experiencia en arquitecturas de datos en la nube, idealmente con herramientas como AWS, GCP o Azure.
Experiencia en gestión y liderazgo de equipos técnicos, promoviendo buenas prácticas y metodologías eficientes en el desarrollo de ciencia de datos.
Familiaridad con metodologías ágiles, como Scrum y Kanban.
Valorable expertise en herramientas de Data Virtualization.
Nivel de inglés alto (B2/C1) para colaborar en proyectos internacionales.




Competencias personales:

Trabajo en equipo.
Habilidades de comunicación, favoreciendo dinámicas que permitan el flujo de conocimiento, con interés tanto en aprender como en enseñar.
Proactividad en la búsqueda de nuevas soluciones y mejoras.




Qué ofrecemos:

Conciliación y Flexibilidad: Posibilidad de trabajar desde casa híbrido/remoto, jornadas flexibles y viernes intensivos.
Formación y Desarrollo: Plan personalizado, programas formativos.
Beneficios Sociales: Cheques comida, seguro vida, apoyo teletrabajo.
Retribución Flexible: Ajustada a tus necesidades (seguro médico, guardería, formación, otros).
Paquete de Reubicación (si aplica): Apoyo económico, asesoramiento, patrocinio visas.
Programa de Recomendaciones.
Programa de Bienestar: Nutrición, Física, Mental. Descuentos con Wellhub. Servicio de apoyo psicológico gratuito.
Vida en GFT: Oficinas inteligentes, eventos, premios de valores, charlas inspiradoras.
Cultura corporativa internacional.







En GFT consideramos que la diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares fundamentales y promovemos un entorno de trabajo inclusivo basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades a todas las personas sin tener en cuenta su raza, origen cultural, sexo, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, discapacidad o creencias religiosas.

GFT dispone y ha registrado un Plan de Igualdad que recoge las medidas a adoptar con el objetivo de alcanzar en la empresa la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres y a eliminar, si es que la hay, la discriminación por razón de sexo.




¡Únete a nuestro equipo global!

Title: Python Engineer
Description:
A Little Bit About Flanks 🚀

Flanks is shaking up the wealth management industry by making it simpler and way more efficient for financial institutions. Our SaaS platform is designed to help banks, family offices, and wealth managers get a full picture of their clients' financial assets—all in one place. 💼💡

Founded in 2019 and based in Barcelona, we’ve brought together a team of passionate wealth management and tech pros, all with a shared goal: to change how wealth management is done. Backed by €9.8 million in investment, we’re growing fast, and we’re not stopping anytime soon! 📈🔥

What we stand for:


People First 🤝 – our team comes first. We want every Flanker to feel at home, engaged, and part of something bigger.
Keep Growing 🌱 – as the company grows, so should you. We’re all about personal and professional development here.
Think Twice, Act Once 🧠💭 – we believe in thoughtful decisions, considering the impact on both our team and our clients before taking action.


If you’re looking for a place where you can grow and make an impact at a fast-paced, exciting fintech startup, this might just be the place for you! 🎯✨

About The Role 💼

This isn’t a senior role, but we expect experience and strong opinions. You’ll have a voice, autonomy, and room to grow.

We’d love to hear from you if you excel in:

📈 Algorithmic & statistical skills

🔄 ETL workloads

You will be part of the Integrations team, developing re-usable solutions that fit key client and partner needs.

Your daily focus? Coding and collaborating with several teams—not just merging code but owning it beyond deployment. We don’t follow strict Agile/Waterfall; we do what matters most, when it matters most.

Our Tech Stack


Python or JS/Typescript on our back-end, using async frameworks and tooling for most parts.
Running on GKE
Powered by MongoDB, PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch
Also, Github, Github actions, Redis, RabbitMQ and other usual suspects.


Things we'd love to see on you


You are a nice person: We don’t tolerate bigotry or toxic behavior—just good vibes
💻 Autonomous coder: You don’t need your work double-checked—you’re on top of it.
You know your way around collaborating with others using standard tooling (git, github PR's, etc).
You are a good communicator who knows how to express problems, solutions and trade-offs.
On the other hand, you know how to read and understand job offers. You can triage what's important and what's not.
🔍 Focused: You know how to read between the lines and prioritize what matters most.
You take ownership of problems.
💼 Wealth knowledge: A little expertise in investments, currencies, crypto, or wealth management is a plus.
You live in Barcelona City and/or close enough to come to the office a few times a month. Living in Spain is a mandatory and non-negotiable requirement.
You’re fluent in English and Spanish.
💼 Experience matters: This is not an entry-level role.
Tech savvy: Familiar with our tech stack—or similar ones.


You don’t have to check every box, but the more you fit this, the more likely we’ll be excited to hear from you! 🚀

What We Offer 🎁

We offer what we think is fair compensation (from 32K to 40K € per year for this role). We're not on the very top of the market, but our intention is to increase compensation as you grow with the company. You will not be left behind. We believe this is a really nice time to join the project as we'll experience some serious growth and changes during this year.

This is a full-time, permanent contract. A non-exhaustive list of perks includes:


A full-time, permanent contract. 📃
A cool office between Sants Estació and Plaça Espanya with stunning views of Barcelona. 🏙️✨
Flexible working hours and hybrid work options. ⏰
Paid day off on your birthday. 🎂🎉
Weekly fresh fruit, coffee, and tea on tap. 🍎🍵
Friday happy hours after our all-hands meetings (totally optional, of course!). 🍻🥳
Team-building events to bond and have fun. 🎈🤝
Health insurance and flexible compensation with Alan. 🏥💸
A digital canteen, thanks to Nora Real Food, subsidised at 50%. 🍽️😋
A yearly training budget to keep growing. 📚📈


Note that for this role we can’t offer a relocation package and/or working visa.

The hiring process ⚙️


Send us your CV, cover letter, etc. 📧
You’ll have a chat with our Head of People, Mireia Barón. 💬
A meeting with our CISO & Co-founder, Sergi Lao.
Technical Test – We’ll send you a take-home test to complete to assess your skills. 📋
Final Interview – Discuss your technical approach with our CISO and/or CTO. 🧠⚡
Any extra meetings you (or we) might need to iron out any questions. 🤔
We send you an offer! 💌


We aim to keep things moving fast—ideally wrapping things up in one to four weeks. ⏳💨

If this sounds like a good fit for you, we’d love to hear from you. Don’t hesitate to send us your CV and/or cover letter. ✉️🤗

At Flanks, we believe in fostering diversity and inclusion across everything we do. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome all applications regardless of race, religion, gender, age, or disability status. 🌈💼
Show more
HTML:
A Little Bit About Flanks 🚀

Flanks is shaking up the wealth management industry by making it simpler and way more efficient for financial institutions. Our SaaS platform is designed to help banks, family offices, and wealth managers get a full picture of their clients' financial assets—all in one place. 💼💡

Founded in 2019 and based in Barcelona, we’ve brought together a team of passionate wealth management and tech pros, all with a shared goal: to change how wealth management is done. Backed by €9.8 million in investment, we’re growing fast, and we’re not stopping anytime soon! 📈🔥

What we stand for:

  • People First 🤝 – our team comes first. We want every Flanker to feel at home, engaged, and part of something bigger.
  • Keep Growing 🌱 – as the company grows, so should you. We’re all about personal and professional development here.
  • Think Twice, Act Once 🧠💭 – we believe in thoughtful decisions, considering the impact on both our team and our clients before taking action.

If you’re looking for a place where you can grow and make an impact at a fast-paced, exciting fintech startup, this might just be the place for you! 🎯✨

About The Role 💼

This isn’t a senior role, but we expect experience and strong opinions. You’ll have a voice, autonomy, and room to grow.

We’d love to hear from you if you excel in:

📈 Algorithmic & statistical skills

🔄 ETL workloads

You will be part of the Integrations team, developing re-usable solutions that fit key client and partner needs.

Your daily focus? Coding and collaborating with several teams—not just merging code but owning it beyond deployment. We don’t follow strict Agile/Waterfall; we do what matters most, when it matters most.

Our Tech Stack

  • Python or JS/Typescript on our back-end, using async frameworks and tooling for most parts.
  • Running on GKE
  • Powered by MongoDB, PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch
  • Also, Github, Github actions, Redis, RabbitMQ and other usual suspects.

Things we'd love to see on you

  • You are a nice person: We don’t tolerate bigotry or toxic behavior—just good vibes
  • 💻 Autonomous coder: You don’t need your work double-checked—you’re on top of it.
  • You know your way around collaborating with others using standard tooling (git, github PR's, etc).
  • You are a good communicator who knows how to express problems, solutions and trade-offs.
  • On the other hand, you know how to read and understand job offers. You can triage what's important and what's not.
  • 🔍 Focused: You know how to read between the lines and prioritize what matters most.
  • You take ownership of problems.
  • 💼 Wealth knowledge: A little expertise in investments, currencies, crypto, or wealth management is a plus.
  • You live in Barcelona City and/or close enough to come to the office a few times a month. Living in Spain is a mandatory and non-negotiable requirement.
  • You’re fluent in English and Spanish.
  • 💼 Experience matters: This is not an entry-level role.
  • Tech savvy: Familiar with our tech stack—or similar ones.

You don’t have to check every box, but the more you fit this, the more likely we’ll be excited to hear from you! 🚀

What We Offer 🎁

We offer what we think is fair compensation (from 32K to 40K € per year for this role). We're not on the very top of the market, but our intention is to increase compensation as you grow with the company. You will not be left behind. We believe this is a really nice time to join the project as we'll experience some serious growth and changes during this year.

This is a full-time, permanent contract. A non-exhaustive list of perks includes:

  • A full-time, permanent contract. 📃
  • A cool office between Sants Estació and Plaça Espanya with stunning views of Barcelona. 🏙️✨
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work options. ⏰
  • Paid day off on your birthday. 🎂🎉
  • Weekly fresh fruit, coffee, and tea on tap. 🍎🍵
  • Friday happy hours after our all-hands meetings (totally optional, of course!). 🍻🥳
  • Team-building events to bond and have fun. 🎈🤝
  • Health insurance and flexible compensation with Alan. 🏥💸
  • A digital canteen, thanks to Nora Real Food, subsidised at 50%. 🍽️😋
  • A yearly training budget to keep growing. 📚📈

Note that for this role we can’t offer a relocation package and/or working visa.

The hiring process ⚙️

  • Send us your CV, cover letter, etc. 📧
  • You’ll have a chat with our Head of People, Mireia Barón. 💬
  • A meeting with our CISO & Co-founder, Sergi Lao.
  • Technical Test – We’ll send you a take-home test to complete to assess your skills. 📋
  • Final Interview – Discuss your technical approach with our CISO and/or CTO. 🧠⚡
  • Any extra meetings you (or we) might need to iron out any questions. 🤔
  • We send you an offer! 💌

We aim to keep things moving fast—ideally wrapping things up in one to four weeks. ⏳💨

If this sounds like a good fit for you, we’d love to hear from you. Don’t hesitate to send us your CV and/or cover letter. ✉️🤗

At Flanks, we believe in fostering diversity and inclusion across everything we do. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome all applications regardless of race, religion, gender, age, or disability status. 🌈💼

Title: Machine Learning Engineer in Barcelona
Description:
Work Location: Barcelona, Spain/On-Site

Engagement Model: Full-time Employment 

Estimated Start Date: May 2025

DataForce by TransPerfect is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in the Barcelona, Spain.

Role Summary

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to help us build and apply ML solutions that scale feature development, utterance understanding, and natural language generation across multiple languages. You will work on cutting-edge technology at the intersection of multilingualism and agentic LLMs. This role requires hands-on development, collaboration across teams, and a deep understanding of large-scale ML systems.

Role Responsibilities


Work on state-of-the-art solutions involving agentic LLMs and multilingual learning.
Understand and influence how large language models (LLMs) acquire capabilities across different languages.
Design and implement systems to automate multilingual data creation and filtering.
Develop scalable methods to fine-tune LLMs in multiple languages.
Create automated evaluation systems for multilingual agent performance.
Contribute to and enhance existing ML systems and infrastructure.
Build and deploy ML-powered products that serve global users.
Coordinate across multiple engineering and research teams to ensure alignment and product quality.
Master’s or PhD in Machine Learning, Computational Linguistics, or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience in software engineering or applied machine learning.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Experience with large-scale ML systems, LLMs, or NLP architectures.
Proven ability to ship ML-based products with measurable impact.
Strong understanding of multilingual datasets and challenges in cross-lingual modeling.
Excellent communication skills and experience working across teams.
Idiomatic fluency in English.
Experience working with one of the following languages: Danish, Swedish, Dutch, Vietnamese, Turkish, Chinese, Portuguese, Arabic, Finnish, Hebrew, Hindi, Malay, or Thai.



Preferred Skills:


Experience with agent-based architectures, LLM fine-tuning, and evaluation.
Background in multilingual or cross-lingual natural language processing.
Experience building tools for automated data generation, augmentation, or filtering.
Familiarity with evaluation metrics for LLMs and conversational agents.



DataForce offers companies in technology, advertisement, entertainment, and other industries reliable BPO and Data Collection & Annotation services. DataForce helps clients collect, label, and organize datasets that Machine Learning engineers use to train AI-powered Machine Learning Models. We work within our own proprietary tools or within customer tools and environments.

DataForce is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

For more information about us, please visit our website: https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

TransPerfect provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. For more information on the TransPerfect Family of Companies, please visit our website at www.transperfect.com.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Who we are

We’re building Mo — a health companion for everyone.

We’re a small team within Alan, on a mission to redefine the future of care by democratizing access to medical expertise. We are building Mo, an intelligent, empathetic, multimodal LLM-based conversational AI assistant able to prescribe, triage, and proactively follow up on care.

Imagine giving every person in the world instant, 24/7 access to personalised medical expertise - through chat, voice, or video. That’s what we are building 🤖.

We kicked off the project in 2023. After a strong R&D phase, we’re now testing real products with real users, and preparing to scale fast.

🐼 Powered by Alan ♥️

You. Better. With Alan.

We’re part of Alan, a leading European health insurance and healthcare company. That gives us access to world-class resources: 700,000+ members, 32,000+ client companies, €500M+ ARR, a talented team of 600+ people, strong positioning in AI (co-founded Mistral AI)

We benefit from Alan’s platform, infrastructure, distribution, and health expertise — but operate with the speed and focus of a startup. If you’re curious about Alan’s broader vision, their Shareholder Letters (2025-Q1, 2024-Q4) are worth a read.

🤖 What keeps us up at night

We’re building a medical agent that works — reliably, safely, and at scale.

You’ll Work At The Intersection Of AI Research And Clinical Application. Our Mission Is To build The Most Accurate And Reliable Medical Agent In The World, While Delivering An outstanding Conversational Experience. Things We’re Working On


🧬 Build internal medical models — You’ll develop and evaluate foundation models and fine-tuned architectures for structured clinical reasoning. This includes working with curated datasets (e.g. clinical cases, EMRs, guidelines), building doctor-like reasoning agents, and iterating closely with medical experts.
📚Inject knowledge in clinical workflows — You’ll augment generation with structured clinical knowledge (e.g. drug databases, guidelines) using retrieval pipelines and hallucination-mitigation strategies.
🗣️ Push the frontier of voice-based agents for healthcare — You’ll research and deploy streaming speech recognition and context-aware state switching — enabling Mo to handle real-time dialogue like a human clinician would.
📊 Develop eval frameworks for clinical AI —You’ll design and run evals, by hand and programmatically, to understand where our agents fail and improve them.
🧠 Build lifelong memory and personalization infrastructure — You’ll explore architectures for dynamic memory and personalized reasoning, enabling Mo to be a personal, relevant health companion


If you’re excited by the idea of building the future of healthcare, this is the team for you - we're at the start of the journey. If you’re curious, here is a paper we published recently.

🎯 Is it you we’re looking for?

We’re looking for Research Scientists with 3+ years of experience (or equivalent research track record) who get excited about building state-of-the-art AI systems and applying them to real-world, high-stakes problems in healthcare.


You’ll work at the frontier of LLMs, multi-agent architectures, and human-in-the-loop learning — and see your work deployed in production, helping real people.
You’ll tackle open-ended, high-risk research problems that demand rigor, creativity, and speed.
You’ll work at the intersection of AI research and healthcare products, collaborating daily with doctors, engineers, and designers.
You’ll have significant influence on research directions, system architecture, and evaluation methodology.
You’ll mentor engineers and scientists, contribute to our research culture, and help build the team (including participating in hiring, shaping our interview loops, etc.).


You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:


Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and/or large-scale model training
Experience with LLMs, RLHF, multi-agent systems, retrieval-augmented generation, or speech processing is a big plus
Product-minded: you want your research to be used, not just written about
Self-directed and pragmatic
Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!)
Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching
Fluent in English (no need to speak French!)


But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:


Mission is the Boss: We have a mission-first focus with long-term thinking, where all employees act as owners seeking the company's success above all else.
Member & Customer-led: We are obsessively focused on solving customer problems and creating delightful experiences while building trust.
Excellence like Athletes: We maintain high standards and talent density, using the Keeper Test to ensure exceptional performance.
Enlightened Despots: We combine distributed ownership with accountability, empowering decision-makers while maintaining responsibility.
Radically Transparent: We make information accessible and written-first, promoting async communication while protecting sensitive data.
Kind, Methodic Optimists: We collaborate genuinely without ego, support teammates, and maintain positive intent while assuming the best.
Empathetic Challengers: We give direct feedback with empathy, praise strengths, and focus on growth through candid communication.
Bold & Creative Contrarians: We think differently to achieve greatness, challenge expertise with first principles, and embrace calculated risks.
Disciplined Executors: We focus on making good decisions quickly, maintain accountability, and break down problems into manageable pieces.
Fight for Simplicity: We eliminate unnecessary processes, stay concise and articulate, and maintain smart frugality while solving problems pragmatically.


🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:


Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.


Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.
Show more

Title: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Descripción de la empresa

¿Te consideras una persona con un growth mindset? ¿Te apetece empezar un proyecto en el que aprenderás cosas nuevas cada día? ¿Te apetece trabajar con expertos en agilidad llevando a cabo proyectos en empresas líderes en su sector que llevan la innovación en su ADN?

¡Sigue leyendo! 🚀

Descripción del empleo

Tu principal objetivo será acompañar el desarrollo de la estrategia de nuestro cliente en cuanto al uso de los datos y la creación de una cultura data-driven mediante la creación y la correcta implantación de diferentes programas formativos en el ámbito de Data.

¿Cuál es nuestra propuesta de valor para tí?


Formarás parte de una empresa del grupo BTS en importante fase de crecimiento y en expansión internacional.
Trabajarás en el proyecto con un equipo altamente cualificado, comprometido y motivado.
Participarás en la estrategia de Transformación Digital y Agile de una importante multinacional con alto componente técnico.
Disfrutarás de 23 días de vacaciones al año.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Posibilidad de realizar una colaboración como freelance.
Posibilidad de llevar a cabo el proyecto 100% en remoto.


Velamos Por Tu Desarrollo


Plan de carrera.
Plan de formación individualizado.


Te Damos Apoyo Para Que Te Formes


Tendrás acceso al programa Grow Your Talent: 25 días laborables al año que podrás dedicar a realizar formaciones y acudir a eventos.
Presupuesto anual para que inviertas en tu propia formación
Acceso gratuito a todas las formaciones de Netmind incluyendo certificaciones (Project Management, Agile, Gestión del Cambio, Transformación Cultural, Coaching... y la posibilidad de obtener certificaciones oficiales de Scrum.org, IC Agile, Lean Kanban University, PMI,... entre muchas otras.)


Requisitos

¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir para encajar en la posición?


Que hayas estudiado Ciencias de la Información, Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otros campos relacionados.
Que tengas al menos 2 años de experiencia consolidada como Data Scientist.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos matemáticos y algoritmos predictivos (machine learning ,modelos supervisados y no supervisados, agrupamiento, …)
Experiencia trabajando con R y/o Python
Capacidad y motivación para el diseño e impartición de formaciones, tanto en un formato síncrono como elearning (estarás trabajando entre el área de data y formación).
Habilidades interpersonales con capacidad para establecer relaciones y colaborar eficazmente con diferentes equipos.
Actitud empática, inclusiva y curiosa
Muy deseable tener la capacidad de comunicarse eficazmente en inglés de forma verbal y escrita.


Información adicional

¿Cómo va a ser el proceso de selección?


1a fase: Reunión de 45 minutos presencial o por videollamada con el departamento de people para que nos conozcas de una forma más detallada, explicarte el proyecto y que nos compartas tus opiniones, motivaciones y expectativas.
2a fase: 1 hora con la persona responsable del proyecto, para conocer el plan de acción planteado en el proyecto y concretar cómo será tu día a día y tus responsabilidades.
3a fase: 1 hora con el equipo que está trabajando dentro del proyecto para que os podáis conocer, ver el encaje y que puedas preguntar todo lo que se haya quedado en el tintero (¡y más!)


En resumen, si quieres trabajar en una compañía con presencia internacional y una de las referentes en agilidad, con un equipo de personas extraordinarias de las que podrás aprender cada día además de tener un plan de carrera a medida para que nunca pares de crecer,

¡Inscríbete ahora!

HTML:
Descripción de la empresa

¿Te consideras una persona con un growth mindset? ¿Te apetece empezar un proyecto en el que aprenderás cosas nuevas cada día? ¿Te apetece trabajar con expertos en agilidad llevando a cabo proyectos en empresas líderes en su sector que llevan la innovación en su ADN?

¡Sigue leyendo! 🚀

Descripción del empleo

Tu principal objetivo será acompañar el desarrollo de la estrategia de nuestro cliente en cuanto al uso de los datos y la creación de una cultura data-driven mediante la creación y la correcta implantación de diferentes programas formativos en el ámbito de Data.

¿Cuál es nuestra propuesta de valor para tí?

  • Formarás parte de una empresa del grupo BTS en importante fase de crecimiento y en expansión internacional.
  • Trabajarás en el proyecto con un equipo altamente cualificado, comprometido y motivado.
  • Participarás en la estrategia de Transformación Digital y Agile de una importante multinacional con alto componente técnico.
  • Disfrutarás de 23 días de vacaciones al año.
  • Flexibilidad horaria.
  • Posibilidad de realizar una colaboración como freelance.
  • Posibilidad de llevar a cabo el proyecto 100% en remoto.

Velamos Por Tu Desarrollo

  • Plan de carrera.
  • Plan de formación individualizado.

Te Damos Apoyo Para Que Te Formes

  • Tendrás acceso al programa Grow Your Talent: 25 días laborables al año que podrás dedicar a realizar formaciones y acudir a eventos.
  • Presupuesto anual para que inviertas en tu propia formación
  • Acceso gratuito a todas las formaciones de Netmind incluyendo certificaciones (Project Management, Agile, Gestión del Cambio, Transformación Cultural, Coaching... y la posibilidad de obtener certificaciones oficiales de Scrum.org, IC Agile, Lean Kanban University, PMI,... entre muchas otras.)

Requisitos

¿Qué requisitos debes cumplir para encajar en la posición?

  • Que hayas estudiado Ciencias de la Información, Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otros campos relacionados.

  • Capacidad y motivación para el diseño e impartición de formaciones, tanto en un formato síncrono como elearning (estarás trabajando entre el área de data y formación).
  • Habilidades interpersonales con capacidad para establecer relaciones y colaborar eficazmente con diferentes equipos.
  • Actitud empática, inclusiva y curiosa
  • Muy deseable tener la capacidad de comunicarse eficazmente en inglés de forma verbal y escrita.

Información adicional

  • 2a fase: 1 hora con la persona responsable del proyecto, para conocer el plan de acción planteado en el proyecto y concretar cómo será tu día a día y tus responsabilidades.

En resumen, si quieres trabajar en una compañía con presencia internacional y una de las referentes en agilidad, con un equipo de personas extraordinarias de las que podrás aprender cada día además de tener un plan de carrera a medida para que nunca pares de crecer,

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.
Show more

Title: Manager Data Scientist Pricing
Description:
En MANGO, estamos comprometidos en convertirnos en una empresa impulsada por datos y estamos formando un equipo de Data y Advanced Analytics compuesto por más de 50 profesionales. Este equipo incluye perfiles como ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers y Software Engineers, con el objetivo de desarrollar plataformas de vanguardia. Estas plataformas permitirán a nuestros squads analíticos crear soluciones innovadoras basadas en Inteligencia Artificial.




SOBRE MANGO:




El equipo de Advanced Analytics está compuesto por diferentes squads de IA. El squad de IA generativa centrado en iniciativas con algoritmos generativos y en el desarrollo de una plataforma interna basada en LLM. El squad de personalización, que crea algoritmos para ofrecer experiencias personalizadas y recomendaciones de productos en tiempo real en mango.com; el , el squad de Producto se focaliza en mejorar las decisiones en los primeros pasos de la creación de la colección. Y finalmente, squad de Pricing, que utiliza algoritmos de forecasting y optimización para optimizar promociones y descuentos para mejorar el margen de la compañía.




Para este último squad, estamos buscando un/a Manager Data Scientist Pricing para liderar el squad de Pricing. Impulsará iniciativas vinculadas a la optimización de los descuentos en rebajas y promociones, optimización de precios de inicio/full-price y optimización de promociones en outlet. Buscamos un manager preferiblemente con experiencia en el sector retail-fashion.




Todos los proyectos se desarrollan en la nube de AWS utilizando una variedad de herramientas y servicios avanzados. Entre ellos se incluyen Amazon S3 para almacenamiento, AWS Lambda para computación sin servidor, y diversas APIs para la integración de servicios. Además, empleamos Apache Airflow para la orquestación y programación de flujos de trabajo, y Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) para la gestión de contenedores y Jenkins para su despliegue. Utilizamos Databricks para nuestro Datalake.




TU NUEVO PUESTO:

Como Manager Data Scientist lideraás el equipo que trabaja en la investigación, definición, prototipado, desarrollo y puesta en producción de soluciones basadas en algorítmica de IA.




En tu día a día…




Liderar el equipo de Data Science en el desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras en el ámbito de Pricing.
Fomentar el desarrollo profesional de los miembros del equipo, proporcionando oportunidades de formación y crecimiento, y guiándolos en su trayectoria profesional dentro de Mango.
Definir estrategias de optimización de precios y promociones utilizando algoritmos avanzados de previsión y optimización.
Supervisar la implementación de modelos de previsión, incluyendo variantes de Gradient Boosting Machines (GBM) y modelización de elasticidades.
Colaborar con equipos de negocio para tomar decisiones basadas en datos y comprender las necesidades del mercado.
Gestionar la integración de resultados en nuestra infraestructura tecnológica basada en AWS, utilizando herramientas como Spark y Python.
Orquestar eficientemente las operaciones con Apache Airflow y utilizar Jenkins para prácticas de CI/CD.
Promover buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software dentro del equipo.




SOBRE TI:




Grado/Máster en Ing. Informática, Ing. Ciencia de Datos, o similar.
Al menos 6 años de experiencia en proyectos de data science, con enfoque en pricing de promociones.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia liderando un equipo enfocado a desarrollo y productivización de algoritmos de IA.
Experiencia en liderazgo de equipos y gestión de proyectos desde la fase de prototipo hasta la producción y mantenimiento.
Experiencia en el uso y puesta en producción de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Sólidos conocimientos en Machine Learning y redes neuronales. Arquitecturas y métodos de evaluación.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones software basadas en Machine Learning y capacidad para definir la experimentación necesaria en este tipo de proyectos. Se valora positivamente haber liderado el desarrollo end-to-end de un proyecto desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Se valora muy positivamente el conocimiento en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, pipelines en CI (Jenkins), etc.
Se valora haber trabajado con servicios cloud mencionados anteriormente.
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar y una mentalidad hands-on.







TUS BENEFICIOS:




Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello!
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo




You got it?

We like you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsAbout UsTravelPerk is a hyper-growth SaaS business travel platform and a pioneer in the future of travel for work.

Its all-in-one platform gives travelers the freedom they want whilst providing companies with the control they need.

The result saves time, money, and hassle for everyone.TravelPerk has industry-leading travel inventory alongside powerful management features, 24/7 customer support, state-of-the-art technology, and consumer-grade design.Founded in 2015 and headquartered in Barcelona, we've grown to over 1,400 people across Europe and North America.

In 2022 we became a 'unicorn' and in 2025 we raised $200 million in a Series E funding round, increasing our valuation to $2.7 billion.We've been winning awards too.

Since 2023, we've been voted one of the best places to work, one of the fastest-growing apps and tech companies, and a leading pioneer of business travel.These are just some of the reasons why global brands like Wise, Red Bull, GetYourGuide, and Aesop trust us to optimize their travel.Hear more about TravelPerk.As a (Senior) Data Scientist specializing in forecasting for Customer Care, you will develop predictive models to estimate future contact volumes, staffing needs, and operational trends.

You will analyze historical data, identify patterns, and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to improve forecast accuracy, ensuring efficient resource allocation and capacity planning.

Collaborating with Workforce Management, Operations, and Product teams, you will help drive data-driven decisions that enhance service efficiency and customer experience.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain forecasting models to estimate contact volumes, staffing requirements, and customer service demand using statistical and machine learning techniques.Analyze historical trends to identify patterns in customer inquiries, seasonality effects, and external factors impacting customer care demand.Optimize staffing and resource allocation by working closely with Workforce Management to align forecasting outputs with staffing strategies.Evaluate forecast accuracy, continuously assess model performance, and implement improvements based on feedback.Conduct A/B testing and scenario analysis to simulate different business conditions and operational changes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Operations, Finance, and Data to integrate forecasting models into decision-making and automation processes.Monitor and report key metrics via dashboards and reporting tools to track forecast performance and provide insights to leadership.Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and implement new forecasting techniques and technologies to improve customer care efficiency.Competencies & Requirements3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar roleGreat communication skills – You can explain technical findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders, both written and spoken, in English.A knack for numbers – You are comfortable with time series forecasting, regression models, and machine learning techniques to predict customer service demand.You will need to demonstrate the following:Coding skills – Strong experience with Python or R, and SQL for building and refining forecasting models.Forecasting know-how – Hands-on experience with tools like Prophet, ARIMA, XGBoost, or similar methods.Data wrangling & visualization – Ability to clean, process, analyze large datasets, and create clear insights using Pandas, NumPy, or Looker.Customer service operations understanding – Knowledge of workforce planning, service levels, and ticket volumes impacting forecasting.Proactive & self-driven – Ownership of projects and continuous improvement of models and processes.How We WorkOur vision is for a world where TravelPerk is the platform for human connection in real life (IRL).

We take an IRL-first approach to work, with our team working together in person 3 days a week.

For Customer Care roles, this can be up to 5 days per week in the office, so you need to be within commuting distance of our hubs.

We believe that meeting in real life enhances connectivity, productivity, and creativity, making us a great workplace.At TravelPerk, we prioritize experience and potential over formal qualifications.

We believe talent and ability aren't always reflected in credentials.TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base, and we want our team to reflect that diversity.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants regardless of appearance, background, or identity.All official communication from TravelPerk comes from @travelperk.com emails, our verified social media, or recruiters on our LinkedIn.

We will never ask for payment or equipment during hiring.

HTML:
1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsAbout UsTravelPerk is a hyper-growth SaaS business travel platform and a pioneer in the future of travel for work.

Its all-in-one platform gives travelers the freedom they want whilst providing companies with the control they need.

The result saves time, money, and hassle for everyone.TravelPerk has industry-leading travel inventory alongside powerful management features, 24/7 customer support, state-of-the-art technology, and consumer-grade design.Founded in 2015 and headquartered in Barcelona, we've grown to over 1,400 people across Europe and North America.

In 2022 we became a 'unicorn' and in 2025 we raised $200 million in a Series E funding round, increasing our valuation to $2.7 billion.We've been winning awards too.

Since 2023, we've been voted one of the best places to work, one of the fastest-growing apps and tech companies, and a leading pioneer of business travel.These are just some of the reasons why global brands like Wise, Red Bull, GetYourGuide, and Aesop trust us to optimize their travel.Hear more about TravelPerk.As a (Senior) Data Scientist specializing in forecasting for Customer Care, you will develop predictive models to estimate future contact volumes, staffing needs, and operational trends.

You will analyze historical data, identify patterns, and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to improve forecast accuracy, ensuring efficient resource allocation and capacity planning.

Collaborating with Workforce Management, Operations, and Product teams, you will help drive data-driven decisions that enhance service efficiency and customer experience.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain forecasting models to estimate contact volumes, staffing requirements, and customer service demand using statistical and machine learning techniques.Analyze historical trends to identify patterns in customer inquiries, seasonality effects, and external factors impacting customer care demand.Optimize staffing and resource allocation by working closely with Workforce Management to align forecasting outputs with staffing strategies.Evaluate forecast accuracy, continuously assess model performance, and implement improvements based on feedback.Conduct A/B testing and scenario analysis to simulate different business conditions and operational changes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Operations, Finance, and Data to integrate forecasting models into decision-making and automation processes.Monitor and report key metrics via dashboards and reporting tools to track forecast performance and provide insights to leadership.Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and implement new forecasting techniques and technologies to improve customer care efficiency.Competencies & Requirements3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar roleGreat communication skills – You can explain technical findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders, both written and spoken, in English.A knack for numbers – You are comfortable with time series forecasting, regression models, and machine learning techniques to predict customer service demand.You will need to demonstrate the following:Coding skills – Strong experience with Python or R, and SQL for building and refining forecasting models.Forecasting know-how – Hands-on experience with tools like Prophet, ARIMA, XGBoost, or similar methods.Data wrangling & visualization – Ability to clean, process, analyze large datasets, and create clear insights using Pandas, NumPy, or Looker.Customer service operations understanding – Knowledge of workforce planning, service levels, and ticket volumes impacting forecasting.Proactive & self-driven – Ownership of projects and continuous improvement of models and processes.How We WorkOur vision is for a world where TravelPerk is the platform for human connection in real life (IRL).

We take an IRL-first approach to work, with our team working together in person 3 days a week.

For Customer Care roles, this can be up to 5 days per week in the office, so you need to be within commuting distance of our hubs.

We believe that meeting in real life enhances connectivity, productivity, and creativity, making us a great workplace.At TravelPerk, we prioritize experience and potential over formal qualifications.

We believe talent and ability aren't always reflected in credentials.TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base, and we want our team to reflect that diversity.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants regardless of appearance, background, or identity.All official communication from TravelPerk comes from @travelperk.com emails, our verified social media, or recruiters on our LinkedIn.

We will never ask for payment or equipment during hiring.

Title: Senior Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Ampliamos nuestro equipo y nos gustaría contar contigo para formar parte de un proyecto en el que estamos trabajando integrados en cliente. Llevamos la innovación y la excelencia tecnológica en nuestro ADN, y trabajamos con actitud positiva y con pasión para alcanzar nuestro objetivo: ayudar a nuestros clientes en su proceso de transformación.

¿Quieres formar parte del #TeamPanel?

Buscamos incorporara al #TeamPanel un/a Senior Optimization Data Scientist, es decir, alguien con experiencia avanzada en ciencia de datos y optimización. La persona debe tener entre 4 y 5 años de experiencia en áreas como data science, análisis de datos o roles similares, y un grado o máster en Matemáticas, Informática o campos relacionados.

¿Eres un apasionado de la optimización y la ciencia de datos? ¿Tienes experiencia en desarrollar algoritmos metaheurísticos y modelar problemas de negocio? ¡Entonces esta oportunidad es para ti!

¿Qué vamos a mirar en tu perfil?

Grado o Máster en Matemáticas, Informática, Investigación Operativa o campos relacionados.

4-5 años de experiencia en data science, análisis de datos o roles similares.

Sólido conocimiento en técnicas de optimización metaheurísticas (Genetic Algorithms, PSO, Simulated Annealing, etc.).

Experiencia en modelado de reglas de negocio y programación en Python.

Dominio de librerías como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, Scipy, PuLP, Pyomo, DEAP, Mealpy, Optuna.

Capacidad para traducir problemas matemáticos complejos en soluciones prácticas.

Nivel de inglés B2 o superior.

Tu MISIÓN o tareas tareas principales incluyen desarrollar algoritmos de optimización metaheurísticos (como algoritmos genéticos, PSO, etc.), modelar problemas de negocio, analizar datos y poner en práctica soluciones usando Python, específicamente con librerías como PuLP, Pyomo, DEAP, entre otras.

Lugar De Trabajo

Necesitamos que residas en Barcelona, con disponibilidad para trabajar 3 días presenciales en Viladecans.

¿A qué nos comprometemos?

Formación continua.

Impulsaremos tu Talento con un Plan de Desarrollo Profesional y Programas de Tutoría individualizada.

Completo Programa de formación que incluye desde programas de especialización técnica hasta idiomas, habilidades en gestión de proyectos, metodologías ágiles y certificaciones. Tanto on-line como presencial.

Políticas de conciliación como el Teletrabajo en modo full-remote jornada continua los viernes y en verano, flexibilidad horaria, días de permiso en navidad, y facilidades para la movilidad geográfica de los empleados.

Beneficios sociales como retribución flexible, complemento al 100 de bajas médicas, condiciones especiales en seguro médico privado o Tarjeta VISA empleados.

Nuestra empresa es hoy referencia en entorno Cloud, participando en varios proyectos de investigación a nivel europeo, y con muchos más proyectos sobre los que podrás diseñar una trayectoria profesional a largo plazo. Aplica y nos conoceremos

Python, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit learn, Scipy, PuLP, Pyomo, DEAP, Mealpy, Optuna

Title: AI Product Developer
Description:
Descripción del Rol:




Estamos buscando un AI Product Developer con experiencia en el desarrollo e implementación de soluciones avanzadas basadas en Inteligencia Artificial y Automatización. Este rol se enfoca en crear productos innovadores, automatizaciones personalizadas y modelos IA entrenables que puedan desplegarse y escalarse con eficiencia.







Responsabilidades Principales:

Diseñar y desarrollar productos IA que integren IA generativa, sistemas low-code y arquitecturas híbridas.
Implementar automatizaciones complejas y optimizar flujos de trabajo utilizando herramientas como n8n, Langflow, RabbitMQ, Supabase, entre otras.
Entrenar y desplegar modelos avanzados de IA (ej. OpenAI, Pinecone).
Diseñar e implementar APIs para comunicación bidireccional, gestión de datos y sincronización eficiente.
Mejorar la eficiencia, escalabilidad y estabilidad de sistemas en producción.




Perfil Deseado:

Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años desarrollando productos basados en IA, automatización o soluciones tecnológicas avanzadas.
Conocimiento en IA: Experiencia práctica con herramientas como OpenAI, Pinecone, sistemas de IA generativa y almacenamiento vectorial.
Habilidades de desarrollo: Experiencia con frameworks low-code como n8n, Langflow, Supabase y gestión de sistemas de colas (RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.).
Integración de APIs: Diseño e implementación de APIs REST, Webhooks y sistemas de comunicación.
Lenguajes de programación: Python, Node.js o lenguajes compatibles con plataformas low-code y sistemas IA.
Infraestructura y escalabilidad: Experiencia en sistemas distribuidos y optimización de latencias.




Qué Ofrecemos:

Seguro de salud privado.
Retribución flexible a través de Cobee (dietas, transporte, cheque guardería, etc.).
Modelo híbrido (2 días en oficina y 3 días remoto).
Catering subvencionado (olvídate del táper en los días de oficina).
Día de cumpleaños festivo.
Innovación constante: La oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo en crecimiento con un enfoque en la IA avanzada y automatización.




Sobre OOPTIMO:

OOPTIMO es una consultora en expansión, ubicada en el barrio de Gracia (Barcelona), especializada en el desarrollo e implementación de soluciones avanzadas de Inteligencia Artificial, Automatización y Productos Escalables. Ayudamos a empresas de múltiples sectores a transformar sus operaciones mediante tecnologías de IA generativa, sistemas low-code y automatizaciones eficientes.

Title: AI Engineer, Spain - BCG X
Description:
Locations: Madrid | Barcelona

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
Fluency in English and Spanish is required


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies


Programming: Python, Java/Scala
Frameworks/Libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras
Data Processing: NumPy, Pandas, Apache Spark, Dask
Cloud Platforms: AWS (SageMaker, EC2), GCP (AI Platform), Azure (ML Studio)
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jenkins
Data Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly/Dash, Tableau
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Google Colab, Git (GitHub/GitLab), MLflow, TensorBoard
Deployment: Flask, FastAPI, TensorFlow Serving, Streamlit


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Software Engineer, Product (Python)
Description:
About Mistral

At Mistral AI, we believe in the power of AI to simplify tasks, save time and enhance learning and creativity. Our technology is designed to integrate seamlessly into daily working life.

We democratize AI through high-performance, optimized, open-source and cutting-edge models, products and solutions. Our comprehensive AI platform is designed to meet enterprise needs, whether on-premises or in cloud environments. Our offerings include le Chat, the AI assistant for life and work.

We are a dynamic, collaborative team passionate about AI and its potential to transform society.

Our diverse workforce thrives in competitive environments and is committed to driving innovation. Our teams are distributed between France, USA, UK, Germany and Singapore. We are creative, low-ego and team-spirited.

Join us to be part of a pioneering company shaping the future of AI. Together, we can make a meaningful impact. See more about our culture on https://mistral.ai/careers.

Role summary

We are seeking passionate and skilled software engineers to join our team. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to build and develop our core platform (API & DX Console, AI Tooling, Connectors, Observability, User Admin & Billing, Partnerships...) contributing to its development and enhancement. Your work will directly impact the developer experience, making it more engaging, efficient and intuitive.

What you will do

Depending on your skills and field of expertise, you will be involved in key components of our technology, including:

Product Development: design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust backend features, ensuring seamless integration with front-end systems using a modern and robust stack.

System Architecture: design and implement efficient, secure, and scalable backend architectures that support our product goals.

Code Quality: write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, and participate in code reviews to uphold our high standards of quality.

Collaboration: work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, front-end engineers, and other backend engineers, to deliver high-quality software solutions.

Problem-Solving: tackle complex technical challenges and develop scalable, fault-tolerant, efficient solutions that improve performance and reliability.

Innovation: stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends in backend development and AI, and apply them to enhance our products.

About You


5+ years of relevant professional work experience
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field
Proficient in Python and at least one related web framework (FastAPI, Django, Flask...)
Experience with large-scale distributed systems
Knowledge of databases, caching mechanisms and messaging systems
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Ownership and capacity to ship products end-to-end
Excellent communication skills
Low ego and team spirit mindset
Autonomous and self-starter



Now, it would be ideal if you had experience with:


frontend development (Typescript, React, NextJS...)
infrastructure management (Docker, CI/CD, K8s, Helm, Terraform...)
AI/ML engineering



Hiring Process


Introduction call - 45 min
Hiring Manager interview - 30 min
Live-coding interview (Python) - 35 min
System Design interview - 35 min
Culture-fit discussion - 30 min
Reference checks



Location

We do not require you to be based in a specific location as long as it is in one of the countries listed in this job posting. However, you will be expected to be available for a monthly visit to one of our offices:


🇫🇷 🇩🇪 🇪🇸 If based in France, Germany or Spain: we will ask you to come to our Paris office 3 days per month
🇬🇧 If based in the UK: we will ask you to come to our London office 3 days per month
We will cover 100% of inter-country travelling and 50% of intra-country travelling fees



Besides, please note that we ask all new hires to come to our Paris HQ for the first month of their onboarding (accommodation and travelling covered).

What we offer

💰 Competitive cash salary and equity

🧑‍⚕️ Health insurance *

🚴 Transportation allowance

🥎 Sport allowance

🥕 Meal vouchers

💰 Private pension plan

🍼 Parental : Generous parental leave policy **

🌎 Visa sponsorship **


currently not available for Germany
available for France only
